Research
articles.contents:
Contents
Publications

2020
2019




d-article ul {
  font-family: Roboto;
}

d-article ul li p {
    font-family: Roboto;
}

Publications
Under Review
McWeeny, S., Choi, S. J., LaTourette, A., Choe, J., Roberts, M. Y., & Norton, E. S. (under review). Rapid automatized naming as a kindergarten predictor of future reading: A meta-analysis.
Conference Presentations
2020
June Choe, Jennifer Cole, and Masaya Yoshida. Prosodic Focus Strengthens Semantic Persistence. Poster presented at The 26th Architectures and Mechanisms for Language Processing (AMLaP), 3-5 September 2020. Potsdam, Germany. Abstract Video Slides
June Choe. Computer-assisted snowball search for meta-analysis research. Poster presented at The 2020 Undergraduate Research & Arts Exposition. 27-28 May 2020. Northwestern University, Evanston, IL. 2nd Place Award. Abstract
2019
June Choe. Social Information in Sentence Processing. Talk at The 2019 Undergraduate Research & Arts Exposition. 29 May 2019. Northwestern University, Evanston, IL. Abstract
June Choe, Shayne Sloggett, Masaya Yoshida and Annette D’Onofrio. Personae in syntactic processing: Socially-specific agents bias expectations of verb transitivity. Poster presented at The 32nd CUNY Conference on Human Sentence Processing. 29-31 March 2019. University of Colorado, Boulder, CO.
D’Onofrio, Annette, June Choe and Masaya Yoshida. Personae in syntactic processing: Socially-specific agents bias expectations of verb transitivity. Poster presented at The 93rd Annual Meeting of the Linguistics Society of America. 3-6 January 2019. New York City, NY.

articles.title: Resources
articles.description: Mostly for R and data visualization
articles.contents:

Data Visualization
R Programming
Tutorial Blog Posts

p {
  font-family: 'Roboto';
}

Data Visualization
{ggplot2} style guide and showcase - pdf of most recent ver.

Trueswell, Swingley, and Gleitman Lab [slides, code] (11/25/20)

R Programming
Advanced R Book Club presentations

Tutorial Blog Posts

The correlation parameter in {lme4} mixed effects models [post]

By others
Tutorials:
A ggplot2 Tutorial for Beautiful Plotting in R by Cédric Scherer
ggplot2 workshop by Thomas Lin Pedersen
Books:
R for Data Science by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund
R Markdown: The Definitive Guide by Yihui Xie, J. J. Allaire, and Garrett Grolemund
ggplot2: elegant graphics for data analysis by Hadley Wickham, Danielle Navarro, and Thomas Lin Pedersen

Efficient R Programming by Colin Gillespie and Robin Lovelace
